column4: I installed Ubuntu for the first time today on my family computer. I've never used Linux, but always knew that it's not prone to viruses at all like Windows and this computer's close to death (parents/sister kept doing things which caused viruses to load and caused a lot of damage). I got this working, and mostly got the hang of it, except I messed up the video. I tried installing EnvyNG and attempted at installing an unrecommended version o
I hope that description provides as much insight as possible.
your description cut off after "installing an unrecommended version"
since troubleshooting video can be such a pain, if it were my computer and I'd just installed ubuntu today, i would reinstall :)
did you try the xserver-xorg-video-radeonhd driver?
that's the one which lists the X1650 in the ubuntu repositories
well it may have just broken down and decided to go with a failsafe which doesn't even bother to talk to the monitor
nono, merely that the system was confused and decided to go with a driver it knew would work but that offers no features.
the X1650 should work, it's got a driver and everything. :)
you can always try going through the xorg reconfiguration and trying to select the driver manually
are you logged on to that machine now?
as in, are you talking to us on that machine?
bummer, as this procedure involves killing xorg and dropping to a virtual terminal ;)
so if you're going to attempt that I'd either print it out or have it up on another computer
no problem, hope it helps. when you pick your driver, try either radeon or radeonhd, and make sure to leave the defaults alone when the guide says to :)
